other_tests.findings: Four prepubertal patients (3 girls and 1 boy) with clinical evidence of estrogenic action and a history of continuous exposure to lavender-containing fragrances.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Breast growth dissipated in all patients with discontinuation of the fragranced products.

other_tests.findings: Breast tissue growth observed in one girl measured 4 cm x 3 cm on the left side with no growth on the right. In another girl, breast tissue growth was noted on the right side measuring 3 cm x 3 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Breast development resolved 6 months after discontinuing use of the fragranced products.

other_tests.findings: In one case, a breast ultrasound confirmed the presence of ductal development measuring 3.28 cm x 2.8 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Total resolution of breast tissue was noted 6 months after discontinuation of the soap containing lavender oil.

other_tests.findings: Pelvic ultrasound showed a uterus that was enlarged to the peripubertal size with a thin endometrial stripe of 0.07 cm and prepubertal ovaries.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Breast tissue completely regressed upon evaluation 3 months after discontinuation of lavender oil exposure.
